definition: to participate in funeral procession/to attend a burial
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: Contributing to the funereal atmosphere is an enforced nocturnal darkness.
sentences.chinese: 對送葬的大氣有助益是被運行的夜黑暗。

sentences.english: THE mood among mourners is appropriately sombre.
sentences.chinese: 金大中送葬者的情緒確實悲痛。

sentences.english: Waves to slash one of the ship, Adventures of a funeral procession for the drift.
sentences.chinese: 海浪爲劈風斬浪的航船餞行，爲隨波逐流的輕舟送葬。

sentences.english: The Confucian doctrine of the funeral of filial piety see very heavy, when at the funeral to do all kinds of etiquette.
sentences.chinese: 儒家的孝道把送葬看得很重，在喪禮時要盡各種禮儀。

sentences.english: The crowd stood in respectful as the funeral procession went by.
sentences.chinese: 當送葬隊伍走過時，人羣沉默肅立。

sentences.english: The funeral made its way slowly through the streets.
sentences.chinese: 送葬隊伍緩緩地穿過街道。

sentences.english: Mourners were not allowed to throw offerings into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 送葬者不可以將祭品拋入海。
她獲准喪假爲父親送葬。

sentences.english: This just put the funeral procession out of the city.
sentences.chinese: 這才放送葬的隊伍出城。

sentences.english: The procession passes serenely, like a cortege entering the cemetery gates.
sentences.chinese: 它們安詳地滑過去，像送葬隊列走進公墓大門時那樣。

sentences.english: Players will hold funerals and wakes for characters who die.
sentences.chinese: 玩家們會爲死去的角色送葬守靈。

sentences.english: The mourners were dressed in black.
To bring the summer far the most ornate funeral procession.
sentences.chinese: 帶來夏日裏最最華麗的送葬。

sentences.english: The procession was going in the direction of the Vaugirard cemetery.
sentences.chinese: 送葬行列正向伏吉拉爾公墓走去。

sentences.english: Several funeral processions were massing, ready to march to cemeteries.
sentences.chinese: 街道上聚集起了若干支送葬的隊伍，將要向墓地前進。

sentences.english: Please avoid parking in front of an open interment site unless you are part of a funeral procession.
sentences.chinese: 請避免將車停在前邊的一處墓葬園，除非您是送葬。

definition: to attend a funeral/to take part in a funeral procession
to wear mourning clothes/to be in mourning/also written 披麻帶孝|披麻带孝
to visit the bereaved to offer one's condolences
to wear mourning garb/to be in mourning
to wear mourning clothes/to be in mourning/also written 披麻戴孝
to see someone off/to throw someone a send-off party
